Html:
Hi, I am trying to use the winforms version in a windows service where I can't show any user interface stuff. I basically want to load the map centred to a point, add some icons, etc. and then grab an image of the map to use in a report. It works fine in a windows forms app, I use a form to do it: I initialise the map (set the provider, centre, etc.), show the form (using showdialogue), then use a timer to pause for a couple of seconds (keeping an eye on the ontileloadstart and ontileloadcomplete events to make sure the map is loaded), then I grab the image and close the form. Not the most elegant because the user sees the form but it works.

The problem is in a windows service I can't show the form, but I can't see a way of forcing the map to download tiles etc. without showing the form, also, just for testing, I tried to call reloadmap and got an error with this: "Please, do not call ReloadMap before form is loaded, it's useless".

Has anyone managed to load the map in this way (without showing a form)? Maybe I am just missing a call to force the map to load!

• you can try enable service to interact with desktop, thats a checkbox in windows service options menu
  • or you can use demo from Testing/BigMapMaker which requires no desktop interaction
